Title: Sands of Iwo Jima
Cast: John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara, Forrest Tucker, Wally Cassell, James Brown, Richard Webb, Arthur Franz, Julie Bishop, James Holden, Peter Coe, Richard Jaeckel, William Murphy, George Tyne, Hal Baylor
Plot: A dramatization of the World War II Battle of Iwo Jima. After his wife takes their son and leaves him, Sgt. John Stryker is an embittered man who takes his misery out on the men under his command. They're a bunch of green recruits who have a hard time dealing with Stryker's tough drills and thicker skin. Even his old friends start to wonder if he's gone from being the epitome of a tough Marine Sergeant to a man over the edge. Written by Alfred Jingle
Keywords: battle, sergeant, combat, tarawa, heroic military
Location: Camp Pendleton Marine Corps Base, Oceanside, California, USA
Actors: John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara
Writer: Harry Brown (screenplay), James Edward Grant (screenplay) | 1 more credit »
Description: Directed by Allan Dwan.  With John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara, Forrest Tucker. A dramatization of the World War II Battle of Iwo Jima.
